meanings.definition: Feeling or showing extreme nervousness or unease.
meanings.sent1: She felt jitterier than usual before the big test.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked even jitterier than the dog during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: His jitterier behavior made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The jitterier atmosphere in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The jitterier feeling in her stomach grew stronger as the deadline approached.

meanings.definition: Moving or shaking with small, rapid movements.
meanings.sent1: The jitterier squirrel quickly climbed up the tree.
meanings.sent2: The leaves on the tree became even jitterier in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The jitterier dance moves of the robot entertained the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The jitterier branches of the tree reached out like nervous fingers.
meanings.sent5: The jitterier motion of the pendulum caught everyone's attention.
